Principal Systems Development Engineer

Company Name Dell Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 55 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Principal Systems Development Engineer
Melbourne, Australia 08/14/2018

The ESI (Extreme Scale Infrastructure) at Dell is a fast growing business unit within server organization with focus on the hyper scale solutions for the global customers. We develop the semi or full customized infrastructure solutions to win the specific customers with our tailored operating model.

With the business growth and the opportunity we see in ANZ region, ESI APJ engineering team is looking for a Principal System Development Engineer based in Australia.

The primary responsibility for this position is to deliver the high quality ESI product and solutions to our customers. The solutions are unique to the customer and requires innovative engineer efforts from both hardware and software. The major task includes deep diving the Dell and ESI product portfolio and technology, understanding the customer requirements and implementing/validating the solution, supporting the post-sales issue if necessary. The role needs to follow the process and work with the various function teams across the geos to achieve the deliveries.

Responsibilities
  • Provide technical consultant and support for the customer engagements; before, during and after the sales process.
  • Capture the customer requirements and assess the technical feasibility.
  • Create the effective and quality solutions then validate the solutions in the lab.
  • Perform the customer acceptance test and drive the sample evaluation process.
  • Closely work with the factory operation team to enable the new solution in the factory.
  • Trouble shooting and provide resolution on the problems found during the validation and from the customer.
  • Setup, maintain and optimize the test environment, test tools and test plan.
  • Track the new technologies and act as the technical experts.
  • Demo the POC and do the benchmark testing.

Skills And Qualifications
  • Strong ability in organizing and managing multiple projects, setting priorities and working independently under strict timelines.
  • Hands-on experience with x86 system hardware as design, development, test, applications, support or other engineering role that requires hands-on use or debug of systems.
  • Experienced in Linux and able to configure and optimize the Linux OS. Familiar with scripts and services in Linux.
  • Ability to document and analyze requirements, functional specifications, design specifications, test plans, and documentation.
  • Thorough understanding of appropriate technologies, vendor products, and competitor's offerings.
  • Ability to communicate fluently in English
  • Comfortable speaking and interacting directly with customers. Prior customer facing experience preferred but not required.
  • 7+ years of relevant experience. BSEE, BSCS, or equivalent
Job Function: Engineering Graduates
Job ID: R62446

[

Head of Retail Property

Company Name Viva Energy Australia Pty Ltd Company Location 720 Bourke St, Docklands, VIC 3008, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 361 views

Job description

What’s in it for you?


This is a career defining senior leadership role where you will develop and lead our Retail property strategy. \xa0We offer the opportunity to work in an innovative and progressive team based environment. Viva Energy has recently moved from a privately owned company to an ASX 100 listed company, so you’ll be joining us at the start of an exciting journey. \xa0Joining our successful business has many rewards; we provide challenging and meaningful jobs that make a real difference to the people and businesses in Australia. Our rewards and benefits are market leading, with performance based short term incentives, above legislated superannuation, product discounts, leading parental leave for women and men and a truly flexibly workplace where what and how you deliver is more important than when and where you work.


About the role


A key strategic role reporting to the Executive General Manager Consumer and a member of our Senior Leadership Group. This newly created role is critical to supporting our retail growth aspirations. You will be responsible for leading a team that develops our Retail network strategy, identifies and delivers property acquisitions against growth targets, as well as managing our existing property portfolio. You will be leading a team that delivers solutions across network planning, acquisitions, disposals and lease negotiations. Our network has over 1,100 retail sites built over 100 years in enviable locations with opportunities for diversification and alternative use strategies. \xa0You will collaborate with other senior leaders and external stakeholders to deliver the optimum strategy and outcomes for our customers and our business.


About you


This senior role will require a proven track record in developing and delivering strategic network and property outcomes. You will be highly experienced in working with different network strategies and execution in a growth environment. The successful candidate will be a strong leader who demonstrates commerciality, understanding customer trends and demographics. \xa0You will be experienced in negotiating, project management, delivery of commercial targets and possess strong analytical skills. You will love working in a high performing team that delivers amazing results for our customers, our people and our stakeholders.


About us


We are the exclusive licensee of Shell fuels and distributor of Shell lubricants in Australia.


Viva Energy Australia is one of this country’s largest energy companies, with operations right across the continent. We’re proud to be Australian, proud of our 110-year history, and extremely proud of our achievements as we strive to become Australia’s most respected energy company.


\xa0Australia relies on Viva Energy. We supply around 25% of Australia’s fuel, refuelling 4.4 million trucks, buses, cars and motorcycles, as well as 1,000 ships and 350,000 planes each year. Today we have the capacity to store 2 billion litres of crude and refined product, and we continue to invest significantly in our business to make our local operations even stronger. Over 1,700 people choose to work with us. We inject nearly $1 billion into the national economy each year through wages and services.


Viva Energy makes, imports and delivers the fuels, lubricants, chemicals and bitumen Australians rely on to reach their destinations. We’re with workers on their daily commute. We’re with families on their school run and truck drivers moving freight across the country. We’re with machinery operators in the mining industry and help fuel the aviation and marine industries, playing our part to keep Australia moving.

Assistant Manager

Company Name Baby Bunting Company Location Chadstone, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 92 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Assistant Store Manager

  • Amazing opportunity to combine your love for retail management and working closely with families and their babies

  • Great career opportunities on offer

  • Work with some of the most loved baby brands in the industry

  • Supportive senior upper management team

  • Making truly memorable customer connections


The Position Outline

The Store Manager role is full time, comprising four weekdays (including late night trade) and one day on the weekend. Our Assistant Store Managers partner with their Store Manager, supporting in all aspects of store operations, inspiring the team to drive sales, achieving outstanding financial & stock control results and delivering an exceptional customer experience with every customer.

\xa0

“A leadership role that will help us be the most loved baby retailer for every family, everywhere”

\xa0

Key Responsibilities

  • Maintain merchandising standards that are consistent with the Baby Bunting image

  • Plan and conduct monthly sales meetings with the store team, to promote store growth and opportunities

  • Financial and business proficiency with a good understanding of financials (budget, wages) and merchandising

  • Assist the store manager to recruit, train, develop, and retain qualified Team members to ensure staffing needs are consistently met

  • Ensure efficient operation and the achievement of budgets for sales, gross margin, contribution, stock levels and shrinkage and lead their continual improvement

  • Improving customer’s in store experience with key merchandise and best sellers in key locations

  • Monitoring market trends and be aware of competitor promotional activity

  • Lead Team Members to ensure highest possible standards of customer service

  • Spend time on the shop floor coaching and development in areas of product knowledge, service, selling and policies and procedures

  • Role modelling Baby Buntings values and behaviors and instilling them in your team

  • Work with the Store Manager to ensure the team are in the right place at the right time

  • Ensuring the maintenance of our safety standards for all employees by creating and leading a Safety First culture


Skills and Experience

  • Strong supervisory, management and organizational skills

  • Excellent communication and organizational skills

  • Supporting, leading, motivating, inspiring both teams, stores and individuals

  • Creating a strong, friendly 'people-oriented' culture

  • You will be hard working, have an extremely high attention to detail and enjoy being hands-on


What you will love about working with us

\xa0

  • A fun dynamic environment and a friendly team
  • Exceptional product discounts
  • Quarterly bonuses
  • Continuous coaching and development opportunities
  • Stable and secure company
  • Retail is no longer just a job, it's a career and careers that start here, can go anywhere!

\xa0

About us


Baby Bunting is Australia’s largest specialty baby retailer with a proud history that spans nearly 40 years. Since 1979, Baby Bunting has been a trusted one-stop baby shop for parents and parents-to-be. At Baby Bunting our core purpose is to support new and expectant parents in navigating the early years of parenthood.


At Baby Bunting we truly believe our people make the difference and set us apart in the industry and we are always looking for great people who share our values and who want to join us in achieving our goal of being the most loved baby retailer for every family, everywhere.

\xa0

As part of the Baby Bunting recruitment process, all applicants will be required to provide a National Police Criminal History check from the Police Service governing the State and Territory the reside in.


If selling and being part of a creative team comes naturally to you and you have a passion for customers, the baby industry and achieving results, don't delay as opportunities like this don't last long!

Store Manager

Company Name Icebreaker Company Location Doncaster Rd, Doncaster Victoria 3108

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 8 views

Job description

YOU WERE MADE FOR THIS


Not your normal retail management gig … we are different, and you will be too.\xa0


You are an adventurous, passionate, authentic Store Manager\xa0who knows the ins and outs of running a success a retail business. Based in our Doncaster TouchLab,\xa0you'll be responsible for motivating, developing and inspiring your team to crush sales goals, elevate their individual performance.\xa0


To be successful in this role you will need:

  • A deep understanding of Australian retail – how, where and why doAussies shop?\xa0
  • Business networks in Melbourne– you know people who know people
  • Sound judgment and decision making skills – you've got this dialed
  • A natural ability to engage, persuade and motivate others – you're the life and soul
  • Excellent relationship management and communication skills – you talk what you walk
  • A passion for fashion and a good eye for visual merchandising– you know how to work it
  • Effective stock management skills – you got clothes in different area codes
  • A great sense of humor and an ability to create fun – you're an Icebreaker

What we can offer you:

  • Base salary and significant bonus with out-performance potential
  • A world-class leadership development program
  • An incredible discount program
  • Direct line of communication with senior leadership
  • Opportunities within a truly global organisation


At Icebreaker we care about our relationships with nature and each other. We are a fast moving, nimble business– the people on our team are here because they want to make a difference and work hard and creatively to make that happen. \xa0We are not perfect, we have heaps of work to do. \xa0We like people who can think big and strategic and also get their hands dirty.


We’re a world leader in merino clothing and supply our outdoor, performance sport and active lifestyle ranges to more than 4,500 stores across 47 countries. We are headquartered in Auckland, New Zealand with regional offices in Vancouver, BC in Canada, Portland, OR in the United States and Munich in Germany. \xa0We also have smaller satellite offices in Zurich in Switzerland, Annecy in France and Melbourne in Australia. We have recently become part of VF Corporation and are excited about what being part of the amazing portfolio of brands will offer us in terms of best in class industry knowledge and global career opportunities for our people.

At Icebreaker, sustainability isn't just a feature of our products. It's in the values and design of our business. View our Transparency Report\xa0for more information (https://nz.icebreaker.com/en/transparency.html).


If this feels like the type of job you're passionate about, and it fits with your skills and experience, please click apply below to send us your CV with a covering letter explaining why you'd be right for Icebreak

Corporate Finance Analyst

Company Name Fulton Hogan Company Location Richmond

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 143 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The company


For over 85 years, Fulton Hogan has established itself as a leading civil and infrastructure contracting business which operates throughout Australasia. We employ over 8,000 people across Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific.


The Role


Due to growth in our business, we are seeking an FP&A Analyst to join the Group finance team. This role will report to the Group Corporate Finance Manager based in our Richmond, Victoria office.


Your responsibilities will include reporting, forecasting and analysis across the Group while providing support for multiple business units. Your FP&A background will be invaluable in providing commercial support through financial modelling, analytics and dashboard reporting on BAU activities and cost reduction initiatives. You will help by providing input into the implementation of a Group-wide Enterprise Performance Management system.


Your background


Ideally, you will be work in a similar analytical function and are looking for a new challenge in a large, rapidly growing, Australasian business. Your proactive and robust technical grounding and are systems savvy will help you succeed in this role. This is a hands-on role suitable for someone who thrives in a dynamic environment. This is a Trans-Tasman and interstate role, so travel will be required from time to time.


To be successful, we require you to have the following:


  • Tertiary qualification in a relevant degree
  • CA/CPA qualified (or near complete)
  • Strong analytical skills, with attention to detail and a solutions focus
  • Strong financial modelling capability
  • Demonstrate high EQ and communication skills

A competitive remuneration package will be offered commensurate with experience.

Director, Business Development - Hotels

Company Name Buzz Products Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 100 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

WHO IS BUZZ


Buzz is a global design company that creates signature moments for travel. For two decades, we’ve partnered with world-leading airlines, hotels, cruise and rail brands to reimagine travel with innovative product experiences. Our creations become iconic collaborations and keepsakes that span luxury amenity, skincare, textiles and sleepwear, tabletop and serviceware, tech, audio and children’s products. By bringing extraordinary brands together, we create carefully considered partnerships that become meaningful collaborations for all.


Check out our website to see some of the unique products and experiences we have created for clients within Australia and overseas.


WHAT IS THE ROLE?


We are looking to seize the obvious synergies of our inflight products with hotel products and build an equally exciting business supplying innovative products into Hotels all over the world. We are looking for a General Manager to spearhead this business.

\xa0

The successful candidate will have built a dynamic career and is currently operating as a senior leader with a larger organisation or possesses a proven track record being a pivotal part in building a successful business development team.

\xa0

You must be commercially astute, bringing to the table process, structure and discipline in building businesses. Ideally you will have been in strategic role supplying into hotels previously or have a strong network in the hotel industry.

\xa0

Responsible for senior level management of cross functional teams from Client Services, Brand Partnerships, Innovation and Consumer Insights, Designers to Product Delivery and Logistics, you must be a strong people manager, leading by example and enabling others to shine. Your strength will be cutting through noise to find clarity and be willing back your decisions.

\xa0

A passion for travel and luxury branded products is essential.

\xa0

Ideally the role is based in Melbourne, but we are open to possibilities depending on your background.

\xa0


BUZZ CULTURE


At Buzz, we pride ourselves on doing things in ways that inspire discovery. Our fast-paced, vibrant culture can be experienced the moment you step foot into our office\xad\xad and realise you are in our Buzz Caf\xe9, with drinks and endless coffee for everyone’s enjoyment.


Our employees are creative and passionate beings. They push boundaries, thrive out of comfort zones, love a challenge and tackle them head on. Our collaborative teams deliver amazing results by trusting in one another’s expertise. The way we innovate and add a Buzz twist to everything we do is what we hope will inspire you.


We have generous employee benefits too, from rewards to paid parental and birthday leave. We might be biased, but we think Buzz is leading the way as a great employer. Our culture is truly values-driven, which is what we believe makes Buzz a uniquely wild and welcoming place to work.


If the above sounds like you, we would love to hear from you! Please be sure to include your portfolio of work along with your cover letter and resume.


We would love to be able to contact everyone personally, however, this is not possible. If you have not heard from us within 4 weeks of submitting your application, we thank you for your interest in joining the Buzz team but on this occasion your application was not shortlisted.

827108767:
[

Business Analyst

Company Name Publicis.Sapient Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 291 views

Job description

Description

The future is infinitely wide and begging to be reimagined and SapientRazorfish is looking for people who have the courage to make their dent in what has always been. If you have an optimism that says there is no limit to what we can achieve in a time inviting those with vision to shake things up, then we should talk. Our work is fuelled by connected thinking, challenging boundaries, and the power of digital redefining a connected world. Our people thrive because of the belief that it is both our privilege and responsibility to usher our clients and the world into what is next. We are seeking those who question the status quo and want to reimagine the way the world works while realizing a smarter way for business to help – all in service of improving the daily lives of people, the world, and your career. Next_reimagined.

Job Title
Business Analyst

Job Summary

As a Business Analyst in our Technology practice, you will play a key role in leading award winning engagements for our clients, across digital, data and enterprise IT modernization. You will lead teams of SMEs to drive transformative change and high quality commercial outcomes for our clients.

You will work on a broad range of projects overseeing the development, technical design, user interface, systems integration, process optimization, data integration and architecture.

You are a technologist at heart and in craft. You have a genuine appreciation for creativity and an interest in technology and its impact on humankind. You display intellectual curiosity and openness to learn about new industries, new fields, new disciplines and are excited by change and learning.

Primary Responsibilities
  • Definition of business and functional requirement for clients. This includes determining how to measure business results, modelling current/future business processes, gathering technical requirements and identifying the organizational changes required to successfully realize the benefits of the solution.
  • Analyses highly complex project requirements to determine impact and/or change to the system architecture. Evaluates the need for architecture changes and conducts appropriate cost/benefit analyses.
  • Process Flow Mapping: across functional & non-functional epics/stories mapped to macro level journeys and regulatory issues.
  • Elicitation and collaboration: facilitate workshops and document outcomes and risks.
  • Define project scope, project plans, and estimations and capture all requirements (Risks/Assumptions/Issues/Dependencies) in Confluence.
  • Handle multiple, highly complex projects from inception to completion.
  • Clearly articulate technology based solutions, present in new business situations and workshops, and navigate sometimes-complex client situations.

Job Requirements
  • University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline.
  • Minimum of 7-10 years experience in delivering complex business or technology solutions, from solution design to end-to-end implementation.
  • Ability to work with cross-functional teams developing business and systems requirements, user interface design and prototyping, data modelling, and system designs including systems flow specifications and system interface specifications.
  • Excellent senior stakeholder and relationship management experience.
  • Ideally, you will have worked in a consulting environment and comfortable working across multiple engagements. Experience in the financial services or insurance industry is helpful but not required.
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills, with good attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) to influence and negotiate with diverse stakeholders and be able to effectively tailor communications to a diverse range of business and technical stakeholder groups.
  • Experience in working with vendor delivery teams and within an agile environment.
  • Passion for embracing emerging technology solutions and pushing the boundaries of what is possible for client success.
  • Proven experience in agile processes and understanding of tools like Jira and Confluence.
  • Proven experience in managing lifecycle of requirements – KPI s to key themes to Epic to Stories, while managing the traceability at all levels.

About SapientRazorfish

SapientRazorfish is a new breed of transformation partner designed to help companies reimagine their businesses for the connected world. With more than 12,000 people and 70 offices around the globe, our capabilities span growth and business model strategy, new product and service innovation, customer experience, enterprise digital transformation, IT modernization, omni-channel commerce, precision marketing, change management, digital operations, digital innovation, data strategy and advanced analytics.
